subject: Soccer
lead_paragraph: Josh Wolff scored his ninth goal of the season early in the first half and Kevin Hartman earned his sixth shutout in the Kansas City Wizards’ 1-0 victory over the Red Bulls in Major League Soccer. Kansas City (7-11-6) had not won at the Meadowlands since April 2000 against the MetroStars franchise. Hartman’s shutout was the 83rd of his career, a league record. The Red Bulls (4-17-4) had won their previous two. ¶Manchester United and Chelsea rallied to victories, and Manchester City’s expensively revamped team passed its first big Premier League test against Arsenal. United won, 3-1, at Tottenham; Chelsea won at Stoke, 2-1, and Man City won its fourth straight with a 4-2 victory. soccer (AP).
